Data.GameDesc:
This is a case about the changes involved in implementing a comprehensive Customer Relation Management (CRM) system in the company ‘The Sales Company’. You are a middle manager in the company with responsibility for the system implementation in your sales team.

The new system will change and impact daily business in many ways. Routine structures and working procedures will be altered and along with the change comes an increased focus on financial results and performance from the individual employee. You will need to focus on your project management skills and management development. The task is to get all the stakeholders on board and effectively implement the change.

The game is created to give you an understanding of how you can implement changes within your organization.

Keywords: System implementation, Performance, CRM-System, Management development, Project management, PMO

Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"da","title":"Mike på vej gennem en forandring"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Mike - On His Way to Change"},{"code":"de","title":"Mike - Auf dem Weg zur Veränderung"},{"code":"fr","title":"Mike - En route vers le changement!"},{"code":"es","title":"Mike - En su camino hacía el cambio"}]
Data.GameDesc:
This is a case about the changes involved in implementing a comprehensive Customer Relation Management (CRM) system in the company ‘The Sales Company’. You act as a middle manager in the company with responsibility for the implementation plan of the system in your sales team. One of your employees, the key account manager, Mike, has been on the team for quite a while. He was one of the creators behind the old CRM system that you are going to replace and as a result, he is having troubled times with the change to the new system. And like all other employees, Mike has some skills, experiences, and a personality that impacts how he responds to the choices you make as a leader.

Your task is to guide Mike well through the change process. During the game, you will become familiar with some of the key elements in change management; Resistance levels and the cycle of change, as well as leadership theories. 

Keywords: CRM, System implementation, Change management, Implementation plan, Leadership Theory

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The New ITC - A Merger"},{"code":"da","title":"Det nye ITC"},{"code":"nl","title":"De Nieuwe ITC"},{"code":"es","title":"El nuevo ITC: una fusión"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The New ITC - A Merger"},{"code":"da","title":"Det nye ITC"},{"code":"nl","title":"De Nieuwe ITC"},{"code":"es","title":"El nuevo ITC: una fusión"}]
Data.GameDesc:
This is a case about the complex change which a company merger often represents. A lot is at stake when two organizations, two cultures, and two professional identities must find each other and create something new out of the old. In this case, the IT companies ITC and Nordit, which are almost equal in size, are merging. Both ITC and Nordit have been facing challenges. Both have experienced stagnating markets and a decrease in the numbers and size of the IT projects they sell. Both companies have also witnessed how more and more of their technologies are being copied or outperformed by competitors. On the paper and in the headlines of the agreement between the two companies this is a merger. In operational reality, ITC is acquiring Nordit and the CEO of ITC takes over the leadership of the new company. As from then, the merged companies will exist under the name: The new ITC.

You take the role of a department manager of the new and merged Project Department in the new ITC organization. The case begins as the merger has been confirmed and the contract just signed. You have already been appointed a new group of employees. Among them, half are from ITC and half from Nordit.

Keywords: Complex change, Project department, Company merge, Management, Merger, Acquisition, M&A.

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The New Leader"},{"code":"es","title":"El Nuevo Líder"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This case provides insight as to how different leadership styles affect employees in different situations.

You have just been offered a management position in the department where you started as a trainee. You gratefully accepted and have just been out to celebrate with a couple of good friends. Now it is your responsibility to lead your colleagues.

Part of the situation is that the department has just experienced some turbulent months that have culminated in the more or less voluntary resignation of the previous departmental manager, who over a long period had failed to deliver satisfactory financial results.

There is a clear expectation that you rectify this negative trend and achieve good financial results, while, at the same time, you make your mark as a leader.

How will they respond to your style of leadership?

During the scenario, you will be familiar with the six styles of leadership; the visionary, the affiliate, the democratic, the coaching, the pacesetting, and the commanding as presented by D. Goleman. You must work on your leadership qualities and skills to successfully implement a change culture.

Play the game and learn more about your leadership profile.

ActeeLeadership won the prize for the Most Ambitious Game at the International Business Learning Games Competition 2018.

Keywords: Leadership, Leadership styles, Leadership skills, Leadership qualities, Change culture

Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
Restructuring and Synergies are about the complex change process of restructuring an organization. You are working in the corporation “Your Money A/S”, which is one of the largest companies within the financial sector in the country. The scenario takes place just after a reorganization has taken place within the company. You have been given a new position as the manager of the IT Operations department and you must lead your 10 employees through the change process that naturally occurs when you are repositioned in new jobs and in new work structures. The purpose of the company restructuring is to create new synergies between the different functions in the IT department. Up until now, IT has been organized in sections, carrying out tasks within the development, operation, and support.

Over time, the divide between the sections has increased and this has affected the flexibility of collaboration and the ability to create a unified image of IT. Through a reorganization process, the goal now is to create synergies and transparent work processes and make sure the department has a clear profile in the organization.

Keywords: Restructuring, Change process, Reorganization, Synergy, Leadership, E-Learning, Mergers, Acquisitions, M&A

Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Long Lasting LEAN"},{"code":"de","title":"Langfristig LEAN"},{"code":"zh-CN","title":"期持久的精益方案 (LONG LASTING LEAN)"},{"code":"da","title":"Langsigtet LEAN"},{"code":"sv","title":"Long Lasting LEAN"},{"code":"es","title":"LEAN de larga duración"}]
Data.GameDesc:
This is a case about the challenges involved in creating a long term and sustainable change in the organizational culture model by implementing LEAN.

The medium sized firm, The Production Company, has been working with LEAN for more than 15 years, but in recent years, these efforts have become increasingly result focused. With a production of more than 16 million units and representation on more than 10 countries, The Production Company is considered a growing player within their market. In the drive towards keeping its market position and aiming to achieve even more global gravity one of the company’s focus areas is to optimize and streamline the production significantly. For this purpose, the company has developed its own LEAN concept with the title: Production Company LEAN Excellence (PLEX) and is currently in the implementation process in its factories.

You and your colleagues are about to go through the process of implementing PLEX in your organization. The chance of success relies heavily on the level of employee involvement and competence development in the transition.

Keywords: Implementing LEAN, Sustainable change, PLEX, Implementation process, Organizational culture models

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Co-Creation"},{"code":"fi","title":"Co-Creation"},{"code":"da","title":"Co-Creation"},{"code":"es","title":"Co-Creación"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This case scenario is about rethinking the sales strategies in the company, and about shifting focus from traditional selling to co-creating with the customer. This case helps you to rethink sales, which can have a comprehensive impact on how you do business in the company. Therefore, change management is also closely interrelated to the concept of Co-Creation

After failing to sell their new product to Projector, Toptech recognizes that they need to approach this customer differently.

They initiate a co-creative process and merges two independent units into one.

Co-creation is uncharted territory for both companies. They agree to contribute with their respective strengths with the hope of a great outcome. Each company choose to invest time and energy in the project. The more they get involved, the more there is at stake; the more to lose, the more to win.

The merged team of Toptech and Projector must balance loyalty to own company and business confidential, and at the same time open up to an innovative co-creation process with one another, where the other company is both a customer and a partner.

As sales manager for Toptech it is now your task to lead the co-creative process towards the common goal.

Keywords: Co-creation, Sales strategies, Rethink sales, Sales, Strengths

Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"da","title":"Maria - Personal Change"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Maria - Personal Change"},{"code":"de","title":"Maria – Persönliche Veränderung"},{"code":"es","title":"María - Cambio personal"}]
Data.GameDesc:
You are in the company, The Sales Company, and your product is doing well across cultures and different customer segments. The Sales Company have departments in 10 countries. But regardless of how well the Sales Company is running, there is a raising need for a new, more modern CRM system. The old system is easy and simple to use for the staff and they are very fond of it. Your job, as a leader, is to ensure that one of the employees, Maria, understands why a new CRM system is needed and being implemented so that she doesn’t throw a spanner in the works for the change process. Here you must use your change skills in order to keep Marias resssistance levels low. You must connect the organizations change to Marias personal change and personal competence improvement. 

This game is designed to lead you and Maria through a change process in about 5-10 minutes and is very easy to play without a deeper understanding of change management and the process.

Keywords: Resistance, Change process, Personal change, Personal competence improvement, Change skills

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Leader in a Digital Reality"},{"code":"es","title":"Líder en la era digital"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"da","title":"Leader in a Digital Reality"},{"code":"es","title":"Líder en la era digital"}]
Data.GameDesc:
Leader in a New Digital Reality is a case about, yes you guessed it – being a leader in a new digital reality. You must lead an organization through digitalization and all the digital transformation challenges that follow. The company that you are working in, is supposed to be paperless and all future communication with customers should be purely digital. Your task is to lead just one employee through the process. His name is Kim and like all other employees, he carries with him a set of competencies, experiences, and personalities that will influence how he reacts to your leadership style. This game focuses on leadership development and especially digital leadership in times of remote work.

The game will introduce the six styles of leadership and takes about 30 minutes to play through.

Keywords: Digital leadership, Leadership development, Digital transformation, Digitalization, Remote work

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Colleagues"},{"code":"da","title":"ActeeChange Colleagues"},{"code":"no","title":"Colleagues"},{"code":"es","title":"Colegas"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
The game Colleagues is designed to be used in an employee session in a department and is supposed to create valuable insights and a common language concerning the changes happening in the department to ensure smooth cross company coorporation. The aim of the game is that employees should become reflective about some of the key elements in the DNA of a change cycle and their own role in the process. This is shown through a simulated successful implementation of something new – in this case, changing to a new IT system that is meant to help the employees in their daily routines.

The simulation makes it possible to be a fly on the wall and experience how colleagues go through the course of change. Furthermore, the case gives a presentation of some of the key elements in the ActeeChange-games; The cycle of change and the resistance to change that is; “I don’t get it”, “I don’t like it” and “I don’t like you”.

The case is shorter than our average management case and takes about 1-2 hours to complete.

Keywords: Colleagues, Work colleagues, IT Systems, Resistance to change, Cross-company cooperation

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Virtuelle Gevinster"},{"code":"no","title":"Virtuelle Gevinster"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Virtual Gains"},{"code":"es","title":"Ganancias Virtuales"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This simulation is about the changes involved in implementing a new, comprehensive case management system, which will replace existing systems in a given academic area, in order to take care of academia. In this case, the purpose of the new system is to reduce the processing time for the individual cases and to give the entire area a quality boost where all the employees' expertise is used in the best possible way. The purpose is also to reap the rewards in the organization, in the form of savings, the finance- and tax department are very interested in these results. 

The setting is an old-fashioned, bureaucratic, public sector finance administration that goes through a transformation, but can be used in governmental training and many different organizations in the work with change management.

Keywords: Tax department, Finance, Take care of academia, Public sector finance, Governmental training

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Turbulence"},{"code":"da","title":"Turbulens"},{"code":"sv","title":"Turbulens"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
In Turbulence, you are a department manager dealing with several restructuring processes in a large company.

In order to adapt to the turbulent times, your company has been forced through several substantial restructurings over the last few years. You are in charge of the change management and must consider the internal conditions such as conflicts and other team issues. 

One change is barely implemented before the next happens, and you have just been informed about strategic measures which have enormous implications for your department.

You have just come from an urgent meeting with the company’s executive management team where you have been briefed about several strategic decisions with far-reaching implications for your department and colleagues.

The demand is that you can implement the changes in your department with no loss in performance and with no extra costs.

The employees are certain to experience this as just another major change like those they know all too well. Although there will be different reactions, you should expect that the change will meet resistance and lack of motivation.

The scenario presents different styles of leadership throughout the game, you will gain insights into your own leadership profile and be able to improve how you use different styles of leadership in your job position.

Keywords: Adapt, Internal conditions, Conflicts, Team issues, Change management
Data.GuidePdfFiles: [{"FileName":"Turbulence Facilitation Guide UK v2.pdf","FilePath":"668d7929-4a03-455b-91b0-c8d3f7848f8d_turbulence facilitation guide uk v2.pdf"}]

gameTheories.Title: Underlying competences from EI by Daniel Goleman

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Maria and Colleagues"},{"code":"de","title":"Maria and Colleagues"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
You are in the company, The Sales Company, and your product is doing well across cultures and different customer segments. The Sales Company have departments in 10 countries. But regardless of how well the Sales Company is running, there is a raising need for a new, more modern CRM system. The old system is easy and simple to use for the staff and they are very fond of it. Your job, as a leader, is to ensure that one of the employees, Maria, understands why a new CRM system is needed and being implemented so that she doesn’t throw a spanner in the works for the change process. You must focus on teamwork, inclusion and diversity as well as the company culture.

This game is designed to lead you and Maria through a change process in about 5-10 minutes and is very easy to play without a deeper understanding of change management and the process.

Keywords: Teamwork, Employee game, Culture, Inclusion, Diversity

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Få gang i M&A"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Get Started with M&A"},{"code":"de","title":"Get started with M&A"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"da","title":"Få gang i M&A"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Get Started with M&A"},{"code":"de","title":"Get started with M&A"}]
Data.GameDesc:
This is an ultra-short game made from an extract of our other M&A game and is about working with successful mergers and acquisitions.

In this game, you will be in contact with David, who is a middle manager in the company, where you are the newly hired change manager. Your task is partial to advice top management in the company about the best M&A buy-strategy, and partially as a change agent, where you must mature the organization for a future M&A buy profile.

You are facing great challenges as you have a lot of stakeholders you need to get to collaborate with, and not least to convince about the urgency as well as advantages of the M&A journey you are about to embark on. In this short case, the middle manager David invites you into his considerations and immediate reactions as you take action to get the M&A transactions started. This game is about corporate development. 

Keywords: M&A, Mergers, Aquisitions, Corporate development, M&A transaction

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"New CRM - Create Desire & Ability"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This scenario is about the changes it brings to IT implement a new comprehensive Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system in the “Sales Company”.

As the leader of a sales team, you’re playing an important role in the implementation of the system in daily operations. The new system will change and affect the company on many levels: Structures and procedures will be changed, and with the introduction of the new system, the focus on financial results and performance of the individual employee will also increase.

The Sales Company has sales teams across 35 countries and has been a leading player for quite some years. This position, however, has been challenged by external forces such as new competitive products and a decrease in demand from existing customers.

Your sales team has been using an old CRM system specially developed for their needs, but this system is not enough for an international company to follow modern standards.

It is now your responsibility to lead your colleagues through the process that such a change is. The game is based on “Destination CRM” but with the inclusion of the ADKAR-framework.

Keywords: CRM, IT system implementation, Customer relationship management, Change, ADKAR
Data.GuidePdfFiles: [{"FileName":"Actee_Game_case_overview_long_WIP.pdf","FilePath":"93983e2b-4559-4df2-a97e-4bcb4d35db06_actee_game_case_overview_long_wip.pdf"},{"FileName":"Facilitation script actee prework-2 hour-postwork CRM game UK 2020.pdf","FilePath":"93983e2b-4559-4df2-a97e-4bcb4d35db06_facilitation script actee prework-2 hour-postwork crm game uk 2020.pdf"},{"FileName":"STEP GUIDE - MultiPlayer.pdf","FilePath":"93983e2b-4559-4df2-a97e-4bcb4d35db06_step guide - multiplayer.pdf"},{"FileName":"ActeeChange FacilitationGuide New CRM.pdf","FilePath":"93983e2b-4559-4df2-a97e-4bcb4d35db06_acteechange facilitationguide new crm.pdf"}]

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Transform by Agile"},{"code":"fr","title":"Transform by Agile"},{"code":"es","title":"Transformación por Agile"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
The game takes you through an agile conversion process in the organization, which will give you an insight into agile strategies, work processes, mindset, and development opportunities that follow with an agile transformation

The game takes place in three stages, from the first decision to start the agile transformation, to the implementation and to the anchoring of the agile work culture in the organization in all aspects.

You enter the role of an agile project manager and change agent, where you will have to create a good balance in the various professional groups in the organization. Central to the agile methodology is that the classic hierarchies are expelled in favor of self-organizing teamwork.

Theoretically, the game draws on Arlen Bankston's book 'HR and the agile organization'. 

This change management game has been developed in a co-creation process with a number of professionals with knowledge of agile processes from the following companies:
Danske Bank, EG A / S, KMD, Topdanmark, Ørsted, Jyske Bank, Simcorp, Servant BVIR. The game development process is initiated and facilitated by HUMAN UNIVERZ, ConCor, and Actee.

Keywords: Agile transformation, Agile strategy, Teamwork, Transformation, Change management

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Customer Focus"},{"code":"da","title":"Kunde Fokus"},{"code":"fr","title":"Customer Focus"},{"code":"nl","title":"Customer Focus"},{"code":"sv","title":"Kundorientering"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
Welcome to the Actee Barometer leadership case Customer Focus. Here you work as a middle-manager in a large, innovative organization known for its high-end, quality products. During the last three years, the company's market has stagnated and price competition has increased. In response, the top management has launched a new strategy aiming to position the company as the most customer-centric business in the market. It is your responsibility to roll out the new change strategy into company culture and into real-time results. This is imperative if you are to reach your goal of being a customer centric business with client focus.

You are head of the group of stakeholders consisting of very different personalities and skillsets. Now it’s your responsibility to present the new strategy to the organization in such a way that it is easy to understand, appealing, and possible to execute within a short time frame.

Keywords: Customer focus, Customer-centric business, Company culture, Client focus, Change strategy

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"AUH - Under Fælles Tag"},{"code":"en-us","title":"AUH - Under Common Roof"},{"code":"sv","title":"AUH - Under Samma Tak"},{"code":"no","title":"Delta Universitetssykehus – Under Samme Tak"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"da","title":"AUH - Under Fælles Tag"},{"code":"en-us","title":"AUH - Under Common Roof"},{"code":"sv","title":"AUH - Under Samma Tak"},{"code":"no","title":"Delta Universitetssykehus – Under Samme Tak"}]
Data.GameDesc:
This case is about the merge of two formerly autonomous units under the same roof, where different work cultures, traditions, and habits meet and need to adjust to each other in a new concerted unity. The case is about two district hospitals moving together to become a new super hospital with the challenges and leadership dilemmas that follow in such a massive change process. The case is made to simulate the becoming of a super hospital, but it can be adjusted to fit other institutions, health care sectors, organizations, and public divisions.

In this hospital traning game, you will have to consider how you will manage the change to create results. And you will have to reflect on how to lead the transition to get people to work with you and take part in the change process. 

Keywords: Hospital game, Doctor, Take care of academia, Healthcare, Hospital training

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Copy of SVD CRM SP - Arshiya"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This is the short version case about the changes involved in implementing a comprehensive Customer Relation Management (CRM) system in the company ‘The Sales Company’. You are a middle manager in the company with responsibility for implementation of the system in your sales team.

The new system will change and impact the daily business in many ways. Routine structures and working procedures will be altered and along with the change comes an increased focus on financial results and performance from the individual employee. The task is to get all the stakeholders on board and effectively implement the change.

The game is created to give you an understanding of how you can implement changes within your organization.

The short version consists only of 3 chapters. Check while play

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The Transition"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
You are leading a transition back to the office and will be faced with change management issues in regards to a work transition plan. Topics to handle includes motivation, communication, and re-building the office culture.

This game use videos actively to introduce each chapter, so you need to be able to hear what each stakeholder have to say.

This game fits perfectly when companies are trying to implement a Hybrid working model.

Keywords: Transition, Hybrid work, Communication, Change management, Culture

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Gender (in)equality at the office"},{"code":"nl","title":"Gender (in)equality at the office"},{"code":"da","title":"Køns(u)lighed på arbejdspladsen"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Gender (in)equality at the office"},{"code":"nl","title":"Gender (in)equality at the office"},{"code":"da","title":"Køns(u)lighed på arbejdspladsen"}]
Data.GameDesc:
This game is about some of the dilemmas that arise in an office where the work culture is not inclusive or diverse. It is about addressing a tense issue that causes a range of reactions in the office. 

You are tasked with leading a small department through a change scenario of creating a satisfied team in a healthy work culture - as part of the company's corporate sustainability goals. Your goal is to create diversity and inclusion (M&I). At the end of the game, you will be presented with a personal leadership profile and an equality index.

Keywords: Gender equality index, Gender equality, Sustainability goals, diversity and inclusion, D&I

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"TestBubblenewteamchallenge"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
The Challenger Sale is a simulation in which you, in the role of a salesperson must try to integrate a challenger approach into your sales strategy. You are a salesperson at the car dealer Turbo. In recent years and despite a growing market, sales numbers have been in decline.

In order to get the company back on the right track, the management has decided that the salespeople must use the new sales approach.

Now a couple has come to look at a diesel car.

Your priority is to sell them a diesel car, but you will attempt to sell them an electric car as an alternative solution instead.

This simulation takes you through the theoretical steps behind the challenger sales approach as presented in the book written by Matthew Dixon and Brent Adamson.

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Agile Thriving"},{"code":"da","title":"Agile Thriving"},{"code":"fr","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"ru","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"fi","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"sv","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"es","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"no","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"nl","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"he","title":"CRM ????"},{"code":"it","title":"Destination CRM (Italien-wip)"},{"code":"de","title":"Agile Thriving"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Agile Thriving"},{"code":"da","title":"Agile Thriving"},{"code":"fr","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"ru","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"fi","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"sv","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"es","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"no","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"nl","title":"Destination CRM"},{"code":"he","title":"CRM ????"},{"code":"it","title":"Destination CRM (Italien-wip)"},{"code":"de","title":"Agile Thriving"}]
Data.GameDesc:
This simulation is about an agile transformation in a company called Flying Monkey.

Your job is to get your colleagues and your internal cooperation well in line with the implementation of agility, so that your company is better prepared for the future, in terms of increased innovation, sales, customer satisfaction, and talent retention.

The result of the agile change process is measured partly by how well you create clarity about the new agile organization, and partly by your colleagues' experience of well-being in the workplace. It applies to issues such as personal job satisfaction and the sense of meaningfulness of daily work. Besides, you also strive for the implementation of agility in Flying Monkey to increase innovation, sales, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. Using the agile methodology, IT development methods and team work, you should be able to make your team thrive!

This game focuses on leadership development, change management, and transformation.

Keywords: Agile, Agile methodology, Thriving, Teamwork, IT development

#Diversity #Inclusion #Wellbeing #Effective #Management #Leadership #Communication #Onboarding

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Turbo tanken"},{"code":"en-us","title":"The Turbo Tank"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
The goal, in this case, is to create a better dialogue between companies and the municipality. This case takes place in the Centre for Technique and Environment. The municipality has a focus on the local business life and wants to improve the dialogue between the center and the companies. You play the environmental consultant, who visits a local gas station because the municipality has intensified its inspections of local car wash stations. Throughout the case, you must communicate with the company concerning several environmental injunctions and ensure an optimal experience in creating an environmental company.

Use eight different styles of communication to get the results you need in order to obtain your goals of public cooperation and cross-cultural communication.

Keywords: Coorporation, Public coorporation, Environmental company, Local community, Cross-cultural communication, Optimal experience

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The Crisis"},{"code":"da","title":"Krisen"},{"code":"sv","title":"Krisen"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
Today you will hold a departmental meeting, where, among other things, you will review your performance situation.

You have just welcomed people to the meeting and reviewed the agenda when you are interrupted by several consultants who have something to say. They want to know how management sees the situation on following subjects: company attitude, the current circumstances, business development and effeciency.

Themes and challenges  in this case:
• What are typical challenges when a department is being closed down?

• How does a middle manager manage that the department has threatened its existence?

• How to ensure its employees’ future in the organization when the department is threatened with closure

• How to create high morale when the department is in a headwind

• How do you handle that your own position is threatened

• Dealing with layoffs

Keywords: Challenges, Company attitude, Circumstances, Business development, Efficiency

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Pas på Sarah"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Take Care of Sarah"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
Support a young woman in her meeting with the system. This case takes place in residential accommodation for voluntarily placed young people, where Sarah lives. You are an employee, the contact person for Sarah and is responsible for the professional and personal network surrounding her. This includes looking out for L&D, work-life balance, talent development, and work stress in regards to Sarah. 

The management has made the decision of using a recovery-based approach to the residents.

Use eight different styles of communication to get the results you need.

Keywords: Work-life balance, L&D, Talent development, Talent development strategy, Work stress

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Market Shift"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This game scenario is inspired by Jim Hageman Snabe and Mikael Trolle's book Dreams & Details. The book is about how new technologies constantly change the prerequisites for success and makes it necessary to re-invent your company.

In the game, you are in a managerial position in a company struggling with decreasing market shares over the past few years. The decision about a seasonal shift has been made in order to future proof the company’s existence in future.

This means going through a comprehensive digital transformation implementing a global trade platform, which means that the customers will be able to handle all transport documents, payment of goods, and digitalize signatures, scans, and written communication. As a leader, you need to make your employees understand the dream behind this transformation and manage the details in this process.

The game presents the dreams and details leadership model and builds upon the main theories behind the framework; communicating the dream and managing the details.

Keywords: Jim Hageman Snabe, Mikael Troll, Leadership model, Dreams & Details, Inspire
Data.GuidePdfFiles: [{"FileName":"Actee_Game_case_overview_long.pdf","FilePath":"0a3aba26-3fa0-4c54-9377-a504ee38c782_actee_game_case_overview_long.pdf"},{"FileName":"MarketShift Facilitation Guide UK v2.pdf","FilePath":"0a3aba26-3fa0-4c54-9377-a504ee38c782_marketshift facilitation guide uk v2.pdf"}]

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"SatMarine"},{"code":"da","title":"SatMarine"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
You are the project manager in a smaller high-tech company.

The American organization RayNavs has placed an order with your company, and in the name of the American specialist in marine electronics, you must develop a compact and cost-competitive communication solution.

You have been put in charge of managing the project group. And it is your job to make the group consisting of employees from the hardware team, the software team, and the mechanical staff works together with the leaders and directors on this project. You must pull on your communication skills in order to reach your goal.

During the case, you will have to take a series of choices based on different leadership styles. Become familiar with your own leadership style and have fun.

Keywords: Project manager, Communication, Leader, Competitive, Communication skills

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The Transition (Teaser)"},{"code":"de","title":"The Transition (Teaser)"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
The Transition is a brand new game about moving from the home office after a lockdown to working out of the office once again. You will be faced with change management issues in regards to a work transition plan. Your team will have to readjust, and their motivation for working in the office might have changed drastically. You must keep a sharp eye on how you communicate and how you rebuild the office culture to the changes.

This game fits perfectly when companies are trying to implement a Hybrid working model.

This is the short version of the game - The Transition. 

Keywords: Transition, Hybrid work, Work transition plan, Change management, Culture

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"},{"code":"da","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"},{"code":"nl","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"},{"code":"fi","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"},{"code":"fr","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"},{"code":"da","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"},{"code":"nl","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"},{"code":"fi","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"},{"code":"fr","title":"Restructuring and Synergies (Short)"}]
Data.GameDesc:
Restructuring and Synergies (Short) is about the complex change process of restructuring an organization. You are working in the corporation “Your Money A/S”, which is one of the largest companies within the financial sector in the country. The scenario takes place just after a reorganization has taken place within the company. You have been given a new position as the manager of the IT-Operations department and you must lead your 10 employees through the change process that naturally occurs when you are repositioned in new jobs and in new work structures. The purpose of the reorganization is to create new synergies between the different functions in the IT-department. Up until now, IT has been organized in sections, carrying out tasks within development, operation and support. Over time, the divide between the sections has increased and this has affected the flexibility of collaboration and the ability to create a unified image of IT. Through a reorganization process, the goal now is to create synergies and transparent work processes and making sure the department has a clear profile in the organization.

This is a short version of Restructuring and Synergies.

Is your language not on the list? Please let us know.

Keywords: Restructuring, Company restructuring, Synergies, Synergies company, Fusion, Merger, Acquisitions, M&A

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Det Udfordrende Salg"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Challenger Sale"},{"code":"es","title":"La Venta Challenger"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
The Challenger Sale is a simulation in which you, in the role of a salesperson, must try to integrate a challenger approach into your sales strategy. You are a salesperson at the Turbo car dealership. In recent years, and despite the fact that the market is growing, sales figures have been declining.

To get the company back on track, management has decided that salespeople must use the new sales approach based on sales theory and challenger sales models. Will sales training be necessary? 

A couple has come to see a diesel car.

Your priority is to sell them a diesel car, but instead you will try to sell them an electric car as an alternative solution.

This simulation takes you through the theoretical steps behind the challenger sales approach as presented in the book written by Matthew Dixon and Brent Adamson.

Keywords: Sales training, Sales strategies, Challenger Sales models, Challenger Sales, Sale theory,
Data.GuidePdfFiles: [{"FileName":"Challenger Sale Facilitation Guide v2.pdf","FilePath":"1ede74e7-3351-470c-a0c6-7f22678b5db6_challenger sale facilitation guide v2.pdf"}]

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Complexity in the Job Centre"},{"code":"da","title":"Kompleksitet i Jobcentret"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This simulation concerns the complex responsive processes that are present in any type of organizational change. The simulation applies a focus on the change paradoxes and the interpersonal relations between all stakeholders in a change process. Based on the theory of complexity your role in this scenario is to successfully make employees from two separate departments work together and make use of the synergies that occur at the jobcentre, “Grønnedal”. 
This public sector workforce game scenario helps you rethink management and focus on concrete processes at the workplace instead of constantly thinking about strategies. The player will be introduced to four different competencies that relate to the insights of complexity theory, which helps the leader focus on important processes within organizational change management and leadership. You will work with problem solving and communication development in regards to the labour market.

Keywords: Public sector game, Workforce game, Complexity, Problem solving, Communication development

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Sammen Om Patienten"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Care for the Patient"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This simulation is in cooperation between Actee and Region Syddanmark (The Region of Southern Denmark).

The simulation is about the changes that involve improving patient treatment in the hospital. You play as a department doctor on one of the two departments that can strengthen their teamwork in favor of the patient treatments. You do not have any formal management responsibility, but have been asked to be in front for operation "Effective Patient Treatment and Prioritizing of Patient Consideration."

You must get acquainted with your own leadership and management skills in order to reach your change management goal. Being a democratic leader using democratic leadership principles is key. This serious gameification focuses on leadership development.

Keywords: Democratic principles, Democratic leadership, Democratic leadership styles, Leadership development, Change management

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The Conflict"},{"code":"da","title":"Konflikten"},{"code":"sv","title":"Konflikten"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
The construction company you work for has been a major player in its domestic market for a very long time. Over a 20-year period, the company has acquired smaller construction companies and combined them to create a very powerful (though somewhat complex) industry stakeholder. Over the past two years, the company’s focus has become more and more international, which has resulted in both the company performing several projects abroad and in more foreign employees working on projects in the company’s domestic market.

The employees are a very heterogeneous group whose levels of experience differ greatly and who come from a variety of small business cultures from the acquired companies. This means that their views on responsibility and cooperation differ greatly, and therefore different management initiatives may be required in relation to the various employees.

Your task is to get the employee group to work together and take joint responsibility. You must also implement the project efficiently and in such a way that you make an impression as a manager in relation to the employees, the management, and the client. In order to defuse the work conflict example and create good dynamic teamwork, you must focus on the social work conflict theory to avoid work conflicts.

Keywords: Work conflict, Work conflict example, Social work conflict theory, Teamwork, Public sector game

Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
The Challenger Sale is a simulation in which you, in the role of a salesperson must try to integrate a challenger approach into your sales strategy. You are a salesperson at the car dealer Turbo. In recent years and despite a growing market, sales numbers have been in decline.

In order to get the company back on the right track, the management has decided that the salespeople must use the new sales approach.

Now a couple has come to look at a diesel car.

Your priority is to sell them a diesel car, but you will attempt to sell them an electric car as an alternative solution instead. This will test your communication skills.

Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
The case is about the cultural differences between professions and different departments in an organization - you must therefore work with managing cross-cultural communication, diversity, and your own leadership.

You have experienced challenges with miscommunication between departments and professions that have resulted in deadlines not being met and it has also affected the overall work culture and environment.

Now you are about to launch a new type of subscription. You are appointed as project manager and must ensure that sales, communications, and the IT department communicate and coordinate about the new initiative.

Keywords: Work culture, Communication, Leadership, Management, Cross-cultural communication

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Agile Mindset and Culture in DFDS"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This game is co-developed with the Danish company DFDS. The game was used in a big session with 200+ employees playing simultaneously. 

This is a case about the changes and decisions involved with introducing a completely new mindset amongst your employees and peers.What decions impacts the organization improving and transforming from a classical waterfall organization to a more agile workplace. It is about making the right decisions, achieving outstanding results, - the simplest way! 

To start the journey, the EMT introduced “The Heart of Agile” (Alistair Cockburn) and “The 3 Levels of Support and Resistance” (Rick Maurer) at this year´s Management Conference. Combined with the existing knowledge of ADKAR, the foundation for a successful transformation of the culture and company mindset is in place.

Keywords: Aglie, Decision Making, Improvement, Transforming, Culture, Company mindset, Employee mindset

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Go Green 1-chapter version"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This is a shortened version of the Project Leader game called 'Go Green' by John Ryding Olsson.

This gamified learning game focuses on sustainability and how you as a project leader deal with project management, design and interactions in the company.

This project leader game was developed through cooperation between Actee and John Ryding Olsson from airbornleadership.com. The game is based on the concept ActeeChange and the book Power in Projects, Programs, and Portfolios by John Ryding Olsson. We hope that this game will create fun and meaningful interactions between players as well as knowledge of the foundation of leadership tasks within Project Leadership. We hope that it will support your training activities – have fun!

Keywords: Sustainability, Project leader, Interactions, Project design, Project management

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Turbulens i Forvaltningen"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
Du er leder i en større forvaltning med mange omvæltninger. Forvaltningen har gennem længere tid været nødt til at foretage hyppige og omfattende forandringer og omstruktureringer for at kunne imødekomme en række interne såvel som eksterne forhold. Samtidig har omvæltningerne været så hyppige, at den ene omlægning sjældent har været afsluttet, førend den næste var på vej. Du er lige blevet briefet om en række strategiske beslutninger, der har vidtrækkende konsekvenser for din afdeling. Hvordan griber du det an? 

Dette spil fokusere på adaptering, offentlig change management, offentlig intern tilstand, offentlig konflikt samt offentlige samarbejds problematikker.

Keywords: Adapt, Public internal conditions, Public conflict, Public team issues, Public change management

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The Top Dollar Learning Platform"},{"code":"nl","title":"The Top Dollar Learning Platform - dutch translation"},{"code":"fr","title":"The Top Dollar Learning Platform - french translation"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The Top Dollar Learning Platform"},{"code":"nl","title":"The Top Dollar Learning Platform - dutch translation"},{"code":"fr","title":"The Top Dollar Learning Platform - french translation"}]
Data.GameDesc:
As the HR Head of Learning in the company Top Dollar Learning, it is your role to convince the rest of the management, that the implementation of a new and very expensive Learning Experience Platform (LXP) is needed.

Some of them have already been convinced that the change is needed and are very welcoming towards the LXP. But some are still quite negative towards the idea of a new smart and expensive system for learning. The new system will be very useful for L&D practices, traning sessions and for onboarding new collegues. 

How do you get them all on board the change?

The game is about management, leadership change, and the dilemmas that follow naturally in a change process.

Keywords: L&D, New colleagues, HR, Training, Onboarding.

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Successful M&A formula By Peter Zink Secher"},{"code":"nl","title":"Copy of The M&A Formula"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Change to Successful M&A"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"da","title":"Successful M&A formula By Peter Zink Secher"},{"code":"nl","title":"Copy of The M&A Formula"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Change to Successful M&A"}]
Data.GameDesc:
If you want to grow your business, you will have to either ‘build’ or ‘buy’. This is the big conundrum for any CEO, large or small: do you always have the time and resources to build yourself, and will your company always be more efficient for building as opposed to buying?

For most people, the answer is no. And that is why M&A (Mergers and Acquisitions) are so popular at every level. Few to none have the time or knowledge to build themselves, so many companies are buying - and it’s a trend that is only going to accelerate. However, with estimated failure rates in M&A typically sitting between 60% and 80%, up to 70-90% of any and all M&A deals do not create any value. 

In the game: Change to Successful M&A, you are the new Head of M&A with the role of a change manager in the company entering a new 'growing by buying' strategic acqusitions.. While you simulate the M&A change, you will consider how to implement the M&A strategy, how to communicate the change, and how to give people in the organization owner in the process, and you will prepare to deal with real-life M&A planning and deals.

This game is build by: Peter Zink Secher

Get the book here: https://www.saxo.com/dk/forfatter/peter-zink-secher_10342295 

Keywords: Mergers and Acquisitions, M&A, Mergers, Acquisitions, Strategic acquisitions

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"new customer focus"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
Welcome to the ActeeLeadership case Customer Focus. Here you work as a middle-manager in a large, innovative organization known for its high-end, quality products. During the last three years, the company's market has stagnated and price competition has increased. In response, the top-management has launched a new strategy aiming to position the company as the most customer-centric business in the market. It is your responsibility to roll out the new strategy into company culture and into real-time results.

You are head of the group of stakeholders consisting of very different personalities and skillsets. Now it’s your responsibility to present the new strategy to the organization in such a way that it is easy to understand, appealing and possible to execute within a short time frame.

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Leadership of Change CMExec - 1 Chapter Demo"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
Change Leadership - Change Management Executive (CMExec)

About CMExec: CMExec is a fascinating change management implementation simulation that offers leadership teams and leaders of change® experiential learning in a safe environment. This enables them to learn, test, and reflect on their change leadership capability and skills. 

Case Study: AutoChanze™ is a global supplier of automotive systems, modules, and components to original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and related aftermarkets. Up until recently, they have been a successful and profitable organization but a recent report commissioned by the Board of Directors has indicated the automotive industry will be impacted by 4IR like never before!

Gamification Objective: During the simulation, the change leaders (in their teams) will focus on how they can achieve the balance between normal day-to-day operations and delivering successful change and employee adoption of a new IT system. They will assess, select and implement their chosen change tactics through three simulation change phases: Plan, Execute and Sustain. They will be scored on how successful their tactics were in implementing successful change.

Leading Change Practice: The gamification uses the globally recognized a2B Change Management Framework, Models, and Tools.

Outcome: The participants will be equipped with the knowledge, experience, a Change Management Framework, Models, and Tools that will enable them to be successful as leaders in delivering organizational change and transformations. They will become more aware of how to manage stakeholder resistance, expectations and feelings as they try to achieve their organization's vision and employee change adoption. ​

The Leadership Theory: Leadership of Change® is based on the proprietary a2B Change Management Framework®, the AUILM® Change Adoption Model, and the a2B5R® Employee Change Behaviour Model.

Receive your personal leadership profile at the end, useful for leadership development.

This is the free 1-chapter demo version. Contact Peter Gallagar if you are interested in the full version.

Keywords: Leadership theory, Leadership styles, Leadership development, Change process, Management

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Culture Onboarding or: How to Teach Hybrid Working"},{"code":"fr","title":"Culture Onboarding or: How to Teach Hybrid Working"},{"code":"es","title":"Cultura Onboarding: Cómo enseñar el trabajo híbrido"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Culture Onboarding or: How to Teach Hybrid Working"},{"code":"fr","title":"Culture Onboarding or: How to Teach Hybrid Working"},{"code":"es","title":"Cultura Onboarding: Cómo enseñar el trabajo híbrido"}]
Data.GameDesc:
Culture Onboarding or: How to Teach Hybrid Working is a game about culture changes, management, L&D, development, onboarding processes, and fears of change. As a player, you will be responsible for onboarding a new colleague in the new normal into the role that you previously filled. Your new colleague has no knowledge of self-management or hybrid- digital working and will need a thorough introduction to these topics. 

The game is based on the theoretical framework by Edgar Schein and thus has an inherent interest in the three aspects that define culture: Artifacts, Espoused Values, and Tacit Assumptions. If you would like to learn more about the theoretical framework, we highly recommend the following books: Schein, Edgar, Organizational Culture and Leadership (1985) and Schein, Edgar and Peter, The Corporate Culture Survival Guide (2019).


Have fun!

Keywords: L&D, Hybrid working, New normal, Digital working, Management

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Design Thinking"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
You have the responsibility for managing a development project in the Citizen Service, in the municipality. The local Citizen Service has always delivered a good and efficient administration of cases, with relatively high satisfaction among the citizens, but it is as if the effectiveness and the satisfaction with the handling of the cases are decayed and the happiness with the present workflows is also downward.

You just had a meeting with your superiors, and you have chosen to use design thinking as the way to get back on track with the satisfaction among the citizens and the workflows in the Citizen Service at the same time working with the effectiveness. The goal, in this case, is to prepare the Citizens Service to meet the future needs of the citizens and the employees through design thinking. Moving down the design thinking process, innovation methods and creativity will be fostered and affect the workflows. 

Keywords: Design Thinking, Innovative methods, Innovation, Creativity, Design thinking process

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Interessenterne på Hovedvejen"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Stakeholders on the Main Road"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
At the Centre for Technique and Environment, you have received an application from a local real estate agent, who wants permission on behalf of an import company to reconstruct a building by the main road. The application contains several problems and is in dispute with the district plan. Despite the problems, the company is expected to create new job opportunities. Now you, in the roles of different stakeholders, must ensure that dialogue is improved between citizens, companies, and the municipality. In this municipality game you must focus on your own leadership skills and development, as well as public- and citizen communication.

There are several stakeholders to take into consideration. How will you handle the company communication in this case in order to reach your goals?

Keywords: Company communication, Public communication, Municipality game, Leadership development, Leadership skills

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Customer First Change (CFC)"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This game is about the dilemmas that occur when customer behaviors change and organizational structures have to be reconfigured to support the new demands.

In the last few years, your company has observed that customer behaviors are changing radically and with high speed. Customers are reluctant to keep a specific company connection - even in those products and services where customers normally keep the same connection for many years for instance banking and insurance products and services. Loyalty to a company connection can no longer be taken for granted. 

You also find it difficult to create a customer-oriented strategy, and develop the customer-oriented skills to understand their 'pain points' - and internally, customer needs are not interpreted in the same ways. It is clear that digitalization, EU regulations, and covid '19 have had an effect on how one can approach customers.

You will be faced with skill development and change management process dilemmas.

Keywords: Customer oriented, Customer oriented strategy, Customer oriented skills, Skill development, Change management
Data.GuidePdfFiles: [{"FileName":"ActeeChange FacilitationGuide CFC.pdf","FilePath":"fc008ec8-cc13-4736-ba87-acf5fbbd6b8a_acteechange facilitationguide cfc.pdf"}]

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Project Leadership Go Green"},{"code":"da","title":"Projektlederskabet Go Green"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
A project is being implemented in an international medical product manufacturing company. A large share of the customers is the public health system, which requires suppliers to work actively with the UN Sustainable Development Goals and meet the objectives relevant to their products and production.

You are now in the PMO in charge of this project management, which involves changes in product, production processes, and marketing strategy. In the project process, you must lead your project team, manage the steering committee and stakeholders in both sales and production. All with the aim of ensuring effective implementation and great stakeholder satisfaction.

Keywords: PMO, Power in projects, Sustainable development, Sustainability, Project management

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"The Cooperative Company"},{"code":"en-us","title":"The Cooperative Company"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This gamification tool is about democratic principles, decision-making, and organizing in a newly founded company called 'The cooperative'.

After several years working as salaried employees, four people decide to found their own cooperative company. A cooperative company is a company run and managed on democratic principles and with a focus on a strong sense of community, a healthy work environment, and good conditions for personal-, competence- and leadership development. All four co-owners have had more than enough top-down management. They agree to start their own company. Each co-owner has a slightly different educational background. They have a common desire to form a good work-life balance, a healthy business, with work that is interesting. All four seek to make a difference in the world as a coorporative entity. 

Keywords: Cooperative entity, Healthy business, Democratic principles, Competence development, Leadership development, Gamification
Data.Length: On your own (15 minutes) - Facilitated (1 hour)

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The Five Lencioni Behaviors"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
Throughout this scenario, you will act as a member of a newly formed team in the security company Fortress. The company is providing surveillance gear and IT security solutions to a long list of international companies and has, for the past two years, been considered to have the best solutions on the market. However, this changed three months ago when a major competitor launched a surveillance system that seemingly outperforms any products you can put into the market at a reasonable price. This had upper management of Fortress in full alert and the decision was made to put together a taskforce that must develop, produce, and start selling a groundbreaking new surveillance system within the next 12 months.


This team consists of the greatest minds the company could put together, without sacrificing the production and development of other products, and you have been asked to play the role of project planner within the team.

 

This game was created with inspiration from:

Lencioni, Patrick: The Five Dysfunctions of a Team, 2015, Gyldendal A/S, ISBN: 978-87-02-17622-3

 

Keywords: Lencioni, Dysfunctions, Team, Cycle, Product, Cooperation

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"The System"},{"code":"da","title":"Systemet"},{"code":"sv","title":"Systemet"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
In the System, you work as a project manager in an IT company and you have just won a contract on a big project for a customer. A customer that could potentially become a big client in the future. The goal of the project is to create and deliver a Content Management System (CMS) for use in the e-business division of their enterprise. The new CMS IT system will centralize the administration and maintenance of all the international websites of the enterprise

You are in charge of a well-experienced project team with team members from your development and operational departments and from the e-business division of the customer. All members know their routines well, and that can cause the inflexibility to collaborate from time to time. Therefore being the project manager on this, will mean a larger focus on web communication. 

The game provides insight as to how different leadership styles affect employees in different situations. It is worthwhile to notice, that the styles can either work with you or against you, depending on the situation. Maybe you already recognize some of this from your own workplace. We hope that the game sparks your curiosity and that you discuss the learnings with your colleagues.

Keywords: Public sector game, System management, Project manager, Content management system, Web communication

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Forældresamarbejdet"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Parent Cooperation"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This case is about parent-cooperation in the daycare. In the game, you have the role of a pedagogical leader, where you work with a balance of managing the interests of the employees, the children and their comfort, as well as communication and cooperation with the parents.
In the parent-cooperation case, you will work with a dilemma about the balance between sustaining the good dialogue with the parents of Tulle, a child in the daycare who doesn’t thrive, and at the same time ensuring that you act to help Tulle to improve her situation.

Use the game to improve the professional communication and dialogue with the different stakeholders you meet in your daily practice in the daycare, kindergarten, nursery, or school - wherever you are in contact with kids and their parents. The game will make you more aware of the importance of ‘how’ you communicate a message and ‘what’ it means to initiate a dialogue with different styles of approach. You can use the game to improve your own communication skills as well as to pass the learning on to your colleagues and employees to improve your common communication in practice.

Please let us know if you want it available in another language.

Keywords: Public sector game, Collaboration, Teamwork, Public team issues, Public school

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Building Better Systems - Health system innovation"},{"code":"da","title":"Building Better Systems - Health system innovation"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Building Better Systems - Health system innovation"},{"code":"da","title":"Building Better Systems - Health system innovation"}]
Data.GameDesc:
Building better systems: Health system innovation 

In this game we will learn to use the four keys needed to unlock systems and solve the systemic and wicked problems we are facing in today’s society. We will use the health system as a playground but the thinking behind can be used for system innovation in general. 

The game is inspired by the Greenpaper on System Innovation Building Better Systems, which is published by the Rockwool Foundations System Innovation Initiative.  The paper lays out a series of steps people can take to create the new systems needed to meet societal challenges. 

We will learn about the dynamics of large-scale system innovation based on the model developed by Professor Frank Geels, the University of Manchester. His multi-level perspective shows how change comes about through a combination of developments at three system levels: The micro, the meso and the macro. Innovating across a system or creating a new system requires engagement on each of these levels at the same time. 

System shifts are unlocked by working with four keys:

1.     Purpose

2.     Power

3.     Resources

4.     Relationships

Purpose: The most powerful way to shift a system is to change what it is for, the philosophy underpinning it. System innovators shift systems by developing solutions based on this very different operating philosophy that demonstrate a new system purpose, around which further activity can be organized. 

Power: It is almost impossible to shift the purpose of a system unless there is also a shift
in who has the power to determine how resources flow, what takes priority, who matters and what is counted as a good outcome. 

Resource flows: A system only shifts when the resources flowing through it change in a fundamental way. 

Relationships: A system is a collection of parts which come together repeatedly to achieve an outcome, a constellation rather than individual points of light. Each part on its own has limited significance; it is when they are brought together that they form a system. 

When working with system innovation, like this healthsystem case – these four keys make up a set. Systems are often hard to change because power, relationships, and resources are locked together in a reinforcing pattern according to the current purpose. Systems start to change when this pattern is disrupted and opened up. Then a new configuration can emerge.
Data.TheoryTitle: The multi-level perspective on systems transitions

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Ny kollega Onboarding"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This game is about the onboarding process of new colleagues into the It department. The new employee must get acquainted and integrated into the office culture, and you must pull on your communication skills - especially interpersonal communication - to get through this change management task. 

Your task in this game is to make the actions in the 3 phases of the onboarding process.

Before the person starts at the department.

At the very beginning of the process.

After 3 months of the onboarding process.

When you have applied the actions, you follow the new onboarded colleagues on 8 different parameters to see how they are doing as your new colleagues.

You will need to balance the request for results, your new colleagues' needs, and the experienced colleague’s wellbeing.

This game can be played by all levels of the organization. Leadership levels, colleagues, projects managers.

It’s a very short game and can be used as a reinforcement tool and can be facilitated.

Please note the profile option at the end of the game.

Also, note you can make copies and customize the game to fit your context for free.

Enjoy the game.

Keywords: Onboarding, Office culture, New employee, Interpersonal communication, Public sector game

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Sarah i Systemet"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Sarah in the System"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
Welcome to the ActeeCommunication case: Sarah in the system - a game about municipal communication processes and the care of placed young people. The case takes place at a place of residence for young people in Denmark. In the simulation you have the role of an employee at the residence and contact person for Sarah - one of the volunteers placed young. As an employee and contact person, it is your responsibility to follow the development plan for Sarah and make sure that it is followed up on it. However, the management has chosen to work with a systematic and recovery-based approach and has initiated a training course for all employees. Sarah is one of the recent-coming residents and she is having a hard time. One day, she may seem trapped and distant and the next day she may be outgoing and potentially hurt herself. It is, therefore, determined that she would benefit from being hospitalized. How will you communicate with the various contacts in relation to the hospitalization of Sarah?

This game focuses on mental health care, healthcare management, institutions, and the people in healthcare. 

There are two goals to be achieved during this case:

a) Make sure Sarah strengthens her development so she can complete her education.

b) Ensure that Sarah's overall well-being is continuously improving.

How will you approach the situation?

Keywords: Healthcare, Mental healthcare, Healthcare management, Institution, People in healthcare

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Maria and Colleagues with Videos"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
You are in the company, The Sales Company, and your product is doing well across cultures and different customer segments. The Sales Company have departments in 10 countries. But regardless of how well the Sales Company is running, there is a raising need for a new, more modern CRM system. The old system is easy and simple to use for the staff and they are very fond of it. Your job, as a leader, is to ensure that one of the employees, Maria, understands why a new CRM system is needed and being implemented so that she doesn’t throw a spanner in the works for the change process. You must focus on teamwork, inclusion and diversity as well as the company culture.

This game is designed to lead you and Maria through a change process in about 5-10 minutes and is very easy to play without a deeper understanding of change management and the process.

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"Retain talented employees"},{"code":"en-us","title":"Retain Talented Employees"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
One week after the end of the summer holidays, the new employees on temporary contracts have now been introduced to their work tasks. However, today is the day the new employees begin to work in the open office environment.

You will need to consider in the onboarding process how you introduce the progressive workplace and value-driven organization. You must also manage the L&D and talent development for Simon. 

A simulation developed by the SIW research project

This case-based simulation- and counseling game was developed as part of the SIW project (Socially Innovative Knowledge Work). The game was built on the research of this project where theory is combined with storytelling and general knowledge of research within the sphere of our psychosocial working environment. The game aims to prepare employees and leaders to handle some of the challenges that value-driven organizations face.

 

Three variants – this game is part of a set of three that all relate to knowledge workers:

1. The colleague, who is responsible for onboarding new short-term employed colleagues into the culture, the tasks, and the community.

2. The occupational health and safety representative, who helps secure a good working environment – both in terms of rules of conduct and the psychological working environment.

3. The leader, who maintains a focus on helping create a good balance between deliveries/performance, knowledge sharing, and innovation capacity.

 

Your own role depends on which of the three scenarios you choose.

Keywords: L&D, Talent development, Value driven organization, Progressive workplace, Onboarding

#Diversity #Inclusion #Wellbeing #Effective #Management #Leadership #Communication #Onboarding

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"Leading to the Green kitchen"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
In this game, the goal is to lead the well-established restaurant through some green changes that are brought to your attention by your new employee Maria. 

Maria is an environmental activist which means she knows what she is talking about and is prepared to act, however, this also means that radical changes must be applied in order to turn the kitchen into something sustainable, and not everyone will see eye to eye on these changes. 

Your job is to figure out how you make the kitchen understand the importance of the changes and ensure that they get on board the mission.

Data.Name: [{"code":"da","title":"SHORT Full Speed Ahead on The Climate Agenda (2-chapter version)"},{"code":"en-us","title":"SHORT Full Speed Ahead on The Climate Agenda (2-chapter version)"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.POEditorCaseTitle: [{"code":"da","title":"SHORT Full Speed Ahead on The Climate Agenda (2-chapter version)"},{"code":"en-us","title":"SHORT Full Speed Ahead on The Climate Agenda (2-chapter version)"}]
Data.GameDesc:
As a player, you are responsible for quality and environmental impacts in a company called Plastastic. They produce molded plastic items to a range of companies internationally.

Your job is to decide how to lead Plastastic into a more sustainable future. You have to navigate compromises and decide which aspects of the company needs to change the most. As a player, you must understand the wants and needs of your stakeholders who represent a broad palette of suppliers, clients, employees, and managers.

Keywords: Climate Accounting, Sustainability, Sustainability Wheel, Acceptance Model, Green.

In this game, the goal is to lead the well-established restaurant through some green changes that are brought to your attention by your new employee Maria.

Data.GameDesc:
This games touches on themes like - Onboarding and retaining a thriving workforce with diverse functional capabilities.

It is a game about how "Alex" was integrated and managed at Actee. the game is based on first-hand experience through ongoing employment of a special needs employee with autism.

When you play the game and make a choice you get feedback form Alex, from Actee and from the system caring for Alex on the choice you made.

Data.Name: [{"code":"nl","title":"Sociaal domein (L)"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc: Dit is een simulatie over de veranderingen die gepaard gaan met de implementatie van het programma Samenwerken, Leren en Professionaliseren (SLP) binnen de regiogemeente Noordeik. U bent onderdeel van het management en verantwoordelijk voor de implementatie, waarbij u bijzondere aandacht moet geven aan het nieuw samengestelde, multi-disciplinaire Team Meervoudige Probleemhuishoudens (MPH), ofwel het "Superteam".

Data.Name: [{"code":"en-us","title":"HART(model) of Agile CRM (SHORT)"}]
Data.Title: Case_Title
Data.GameDesc:
This is the short version case about the changes involved in implementing a comprehensive Customer Relation Management (CRM) using the the HART of Agile model.  we are following the company ‘The Sales Company’. You as player will be a middle manager in the company with responsibility for implementation of the CRM system in your sales team.

The new system will change and impact the daily business in many ways. Routine structures and working procedures will be altered and along with the change comes an increased focus on financial results and performance from the individual employee. The task is to get all the stakeholders on board and effectively implement the change.

The game is created to give you an understanding of how you can implement changes within your organization.

The short version consists only of 3 chapters.
Data.Length: 30 min sigle player and from 3 hours to one day facilitated
